<cs> my lords in rising to address your lordships house for the first time i crave the customary indulgence of the house to a maiden speaker <e> <s> but my diffidence on this occasion is much tempered by the fact that i am able to speak about aid for foreign countries <e> <s> my gratitude springs from years of my ministry as priest and bishop which began in a country which lived under the indignity of having to survive by foreign aid as well as with all the problems of the poverty which called for that aids necessity <e> <s> i lived in south korea and when i left it after years not only was that country on the way to solving the problems of its poverty but it had gained or regained a sense of proper pride as a nation and a psychological poise which one had scarcely hoped that it might have <e>

<cs> my lords i am grateful indeed for what has been said by the noble lords lord stewart and lord ritchie and by the noble baroness lady carnegy <e> <s> they have well established the subject and drawn attention to some points that i wish to embroider <e> <s> i am grateful to the noble baroness who has spoken about the spiritual aspect of the subject and has alluded to unemployment on which i hope to say something further <e> <s> i am particularly grateful that we have already had some indication of the breadth of meaning behind the term community education <e> <s> i find in talking to those involved in community education in leicestershire that they have imaginations of extreme fecundity <e> <s> they are constantly renewing and revising their ideas <e> <s> nothing about community education could be more healthy than that <e>

<cs> my lords the theory of charity and the action of the law of charity is of course important in my life in many ways <e> <s> i should like to thank the noble lord lord allen for providing me with this opportunity to speak on certain aspects which are particularly in the mind of a bishop <e> <s> i should like also to thank the noble lord lord houghton of sowerby for what he said about spurious spirituality in charity <e>
